segments.text: I see the woman in her apron, focused on drying that plate as if the world around her has paused.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but wonder how she hasn’t noticed the water spilling over the edge of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle beneath her foot is slowly growing, yet her expression remains unchanged.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how oblivious she is to everything else happening in the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are clearly up to something mischievous, and it’s both charming and alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the boy wobbling on that unstable stool, reaching for the cookies as if it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I worry that one wrong move and he could topple over, and no one would even react in time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands by, watching intently, her outstretched hand filled with hope for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The idyllic view outside makes the chaos inside seem all the more surreal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a snapshot of everyday life, but it feels so precarious, like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR
